member.name: T:OwlDotNetApi.OwlEdgeList
member.summary: Represents a collection of OwlEdge objects
member.remarks: This class implements the IOwlEdgeCollection interface. This collection has been implemented using an Arraylist and this enables the collection to have duplicate entries. This is required because a particular node in the OWL graph can have multiple child (or parent) edges that point to distinct nodes.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlEdgeList.Contains(OwlDotNetApi.IOwlEdge)
member.summary: Determines whether an edge is present in this collection
member.param: The Edge to locate in the collection
member.returns: True if the Edge was found in the collection
member.remarks: This method is a wrapper around the ArrayList.Contains(object) method and thus is O(n) operation. Additionally ArrayList.Contains calls Object.equals to determine equality and so you cannot use this method to determine if an edge with the same edgeID is a member of this collection.

member.param: The edge to remove

member.remarks: If the edge exists then it is removed by calling the ArrayList.Remove method which is an O(n) operation.

member.name: T:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph
member.summary: Represents an OWL Graph.
member.remarks: This is an implementation of the IOwlGraph interface. This class maintain a collection of Nodes and a separate collection of Litrerals in order to allow distinguishing between Nodes and Literals with the same value.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OwlGraph class.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddNode(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a node to the Graph
member.param: A string representing the URI of the new node.
member.exception: The specified nodeUri is not a well formed URI.
member.returns: An object that implements the IOwlNode interface. This is a reference to the new node added. This method checks the graph to determine whether the node with the specified URI exists. If it does then a reference to the existing node is returned. If it does not exist then a new node is created, added to the graph and returned.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddNode(OwlDotNetApi.IOwlNode)
member.summary: Adds a new node to the graph.
member.param: An object that implements the IOwlNode interface. This is the new node to add.
member.exception: A node with the same ID already exists in the Graph.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddEdge(OwlDotNetApi.IOwlEdge)
member.summary: Adds an edge to the graph
member.param: An object that implements the IOwlEdge interface
member.exception: The specified edge object is a null reference

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddLiteral(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a literal to the Graph
member.param: A string representing the value of the literal.
member.returns: An object that implements the IOwlLiteral interface. This is a reference to the newly added literal.
member.remarks: This method looks in the graph to determine whether a literal with the specified value (and a null datatype and langID) exists in the Graph. If the literal exists a reference to the existing literal is returned. If it does not exist then a new literal (with the specified value, and null datatype and LangID) is created, added to the graph and returned.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddLiteral(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a literal to the Graph
member.param: A string representing the value of the literal.
A string representing the Language ID of the literal.
A string representing the datatype URI of the literal.
member.returns: An object that implements the IOwlLiteral interface. This is a reference to the newly added literal.
member.exception: The specified datatype URI is not null and is not a well formed URI.
member.remarks: This method looks in the graph to determine whether a literal with the specified value, datatype and langID exists in the Graph. If the literal exists a reference to the existing literal is returned. If it does not exist then a new literal with the specified value, datatype and LangID is created, added to the graph and returned. Any parameter supplied to this method, except literalValue, can be null or empty and it will be ignored.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlGraph.AddLiteral(OwlDotNetApi.IOwlLiteral)
member.summary: Adds a literal to the graph
member.param: The new literal to add.
member.exception: A literal with the same value, datatype URI and language ID alreday exists in the graph.

member.name: T:OwlDotNetApi.OwlLiteral

member.remarks: A literal is uniquely identified by its value, LanguageID and Datatype URI. The ID of a Literal is composed of a concatenated string of these three value. If the Datatype and Language ID are not specified then they are assumed to be null (default for the locale or data) and the ID is set to the value.

member.summary: Create a node from the rdf:resource attribute and attach it to a given edge as a child
member.param: The XmlNode that contains the rdf:resource attribute.
The edge to which the new childnode must be added.
The URI specified by the rdf:resource attribute.
member.remarks: If the specified Uri is null or empty a new blank node URI is created. If it is a relative URI then it is converted to an absolute URI by prefixing it with the value given by xml:base

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.MoveEdges(OwlDotNetApi.OwlNode,OwlDotNetApi.OwlNode)
member.summary: Moves all the edges associated with the source node to the destination node
member.param: The node from which the edges are to be moved.
The node to which the edges are to be moved
member.remarks: This method moves all the edges from the src node to the dest node. The src node is not removed from the graph.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.QualifyResource(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the value given by rdf:about into a fully qualified Uri
member.param: The value specified by the rdf:about attribute
An string specifying an xml:base Uri to use. This parameter can be null.
member.returns: A well formed Uri string
member.remarks: This method should only be used to convert rdf:about and rdf:resource values into fully qualified URIs. If the xmlBaseUriString is null or an empty string then the global value for xml:base will be used.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.GetAbsolutePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an absolute path by combining the initial path and a relative path
member.param: A string representing the initial path
A string representing the relative path
member.returns: A string representing the absolute path formed by the combination of the initial and relative paths.
member.remarks: The init path should be terminated at both ends by / or \ characters. This method concatenates the initial and relative paths and returns an absolute path with proper handling of ../ prefixes on the relative path

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.PrependXmlBase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes a URI string from the specified ID by prepending the uri specified by xml:base to it
member.param: The ID to convert to a URI string
A string containing an xml:base Uri to use rather than the global xml:base Uri.
member.remarks: This method checks the given xmlBaseUri string for the value of the xml:base URI to prepend to the ID. If it is null or an empty string then the global xml:base is used.
member.returns: A string containing a well formed URI.

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.GetXmlBase(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Gets the value of the xml:base attribute from the XmlNode if one exists
member.param: An Xml Node
member.returns: A string containing the xml:base uri. Returns null if the xml:base attribute is not found

member.name: M:OwlDotNetApi.OwlXmlParser.IsOwlRdfXmlProperty(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Determines whether the XML Node is a property that is part of the RDF or XML syntax
member.param: An XmlNode
member.returns: True if the property is part of the OWL, RDF or XML syntax or if the property is reserved for use by xml
member.remarks: This method returns true is the property localname or prefix begins with xml (regardless of whether xml is in uppercase, lowercase or any combination thereof.
